body.p: Which of the following would serve the same function for smell that salivary glands serve for taste?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would correspond to the chemical being tasted, sometimes also called a tastant.
Incorrect. This would correspond to the epithelial taste receptor cell in the taste bud.
Correct. Both saliva and mucus are necessary to detect a chemical. If your tongue or nasal cavity is very dry you will be less able to taste or smell something.

part.hint: Both taste and smell receptors respond only to dissolved chemicals.
